newsitem.title: GREECE: Greek bonds fall, ecu/drs ranges, depos, forwards up.
newsitem.headline: Greek bonds fall, ecu/drs ranges, depos, forwards up.

text.p: Greek fixed coupon bonds and zeros continued to be under selling pressure from abroad, ecu/drachma was steady above 311 and the interbank depo and forward curves were up, traders said.

"Prices of fixed coupon bonds have shed 30 to 40 basis points and zeros about 10-15 basis points since this morning on sales from abroad," said a dealer at a private bank. "This is not profit-taking."

The dealer attributed the selling pressure to more expensive interbank funding and the deputy finance minister's announcement on Thursday that Greece will issue 12-month T-bills on June 2, auction 10-year fixed coupon bonds and reopen binds for three-, five- and seven-year fixed coupon bonds on June 19.

Deputy Finance Minister Nikos Christodoulakis said on Thursday that the treasury will issue 12-month T-bills at 9.60 percent on June 2, down 10 basis points, and reopen bids for three-, five- and seven-year coupon bonds on June 19.
Greece auctioned three-year, 9.80 percent bonds, five-year, 9.20 percent bonds and seven-year, 8.9 percent bonds on March 19.

"The market cannot absorb large amounts of debt paper and the ministry should make sure that a relatively small amount of paper is auctioned in June," the trader said. "If this does not happen, we can see prices at lower levels."
Players rushed to lock in profits and secure funding for the debt paper to be auctioned in June after the minister's announcement on Thursday driving bond prices lower.
Interbank depos and forex forwards were firmer across-the-board as players sought funding for the T-bill and coupon bonds, money market dealers said.
"Depos are up 10 to 15 basis points across-the-spectrum and implied drachma rates from forex forwards are up 10 to 30 basis points from tomnext to one-year," a dealer said.
Funding for June debt paper and some forex outflows were responsible for the rate rise, dealers said.
Ecu/drachma was trading in the 311.15/50 range since this morning and dealers said they were waiting to see the central bank's stance at the fixing.

"We can see ecu/drachma much higher if Bank of Greece does not intervene at the fixing today," said a forex dealer. "It is only fear that the central bank will intervene at the fixing that keeps ecu/drachma capped at these levels."
The central bank has to demonstrate that it is behind its hard drachma policy.
The mark was quoted at 159.40/50 from Thursday's 159.450 fix, the dollar at 269.51/61 drachmas from 269.560 and the ecu at 311.08/18 from 311.080 drachmas.
The National Bank of Greece, the domestic money
market's biggest player, quoted the following early rates:
** Overnight at 9.70-10.20
** One week at 9.70-10.20
** Two weeks at 9.70-10.20
** Three weeks at 9.70-10.20
** One month at 9.70-10.20
** Two months at 9.70-10.20
** Three months at 9.70-10.20
** Six months at 9.70-10.20
** Nine months at 9.70-10.20
** Twelve months at 9.70-10.20
--Dimitris Kontogiannis, Athens Newsroom +301 3311812-4
